poem:
Title: A Play of Life

On the stage of life,
Rafe and Esther, persist-
their struggle silenced by a 
joyful gurgle.

From empty cradle 
to raucous household, 
a script traced in tears
and laughter.

Princess and Tyler,
once unseen, now heard,
wisecracks echo in frothy youth,
the play resounds-
with victory, with love. 

A poignant tale,
fundamentally familiar,
of trying, of loving,
always, relentlessly trying.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s great!’ Rafe Spall on having a baby with his co-star in Trying, the infertility sitcom As the fourth season of Trying lands, things have moved on a lot for the sparky everycouple, played by Rafe Spall and Esther Smith. Their painful journey through infertility, from season one, is long behind them. The two kids they adopted tortuously through seasons two and three, Princess and Tyler, are now cranky, wisecracking youths. Princess, now played by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
